physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. Only his head and upper torso are captured in the photograph. He is wearing his ethnic costume, which has a collar and frog buttons running down the front.
sgcool_label_text:
This carte de visite shows a man wearing a shirt with frog buttons down the front. The shopmark ‘Hee Yun’ is printed on the lower edge of the carte.  

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
subject_terms_1: black-and-white photographs studio portraits men (male humans) folk costume
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Men Ethnic costume
